com.github.upthewaterspout.fates.core.states.tree

Class DecisionTree<K>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.upthewaterspout.fates.core.states.tree.DecisionTree<K>

  • public class DecisionTree<K>
extends java.lang.Object
    A tree data structure used to keep track of possible decisions during the execution of a test.

    Each DecisionTree represents a single decision point. That decision leads to more decisions, which of which is represented by a DecisionTree. To get all of the decisions that lead from this state, see getSubTrees()

    This data structure is designed to be explored and populated gradually, So each DecisionTree through three possible states

    DecisionTree.State.UNTESTED -> DecisionTree.State.PARTIALLY_TESTED -> DecisionTree.State.COMPLETELY_TESTED

    An untested DecisionTree has never been visited, and has unknown choices. A partially tested Tree knows what possible choices should be made, but some of them may be unexplored. A completely tested Tree had all subtrees explored.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DecisionTree

        public DecisionTree(DecisionTree parent,
                    K decision)
        Create a new decision tree
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent tree, or null if this is the very first decision to be made
        decision - The choice that lead to this tree, or null if this is the very first decision

    • Method Detail

      • setOptions

        public <N> void setOptions(java.util.Set<N> options)
        Set the choices that can be made at this decision point. When set, all subtrees will initially be DecisionTree.State.UNTESTED. If there are no options, then this is the end of a test is there for marked as DecisionTree.State.COMPLETELY_TESTED.
        Type Parameters:
        N - The type of options
        Parameters:
        options - The choices at this decision point

      • isCompletelyTested

        public boolean isCompletelyTested()
        Returns:
        true if all subtrees of this tree have been completely explored

      • getDecision

        public K getDecision()
        Returns:
        The choice that lead to this decision point

      • getState

        public DecisionTree.State getState()
        Returns:
        the state of this tree

      • getSubTrees

        public java.util.Collection<DecisionTree<?>> getSubTrees()
        Get all decisions that follow from this one. Some of these may actually be the end of the test, or completely unexplored states.
        Returns:
        the immediately following decisions
